sap.viz.ui5.Combination.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Combination Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

sap.viz.ui5.HorizontalArea100.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.HorizontalArea100 Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Area
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

attachHideTooltip.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} event of this sap.viz.ui5.HorizontalArea100. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.viz.ui5.HorizontalArea100 itself. This event is deprecated, please use hideDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover out of the specific part of chart, no data is passed.

sap.viz.ui5.types.VerticalBar_animation.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

width.!description: Width of the VizControl as a CSS size.

uiConfig.!description: Configuration for initialization to VizControl. This property could only set via settings parameter in Constructor.

height.!description: Height of the VizControl as a CSS size.

Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Settings for the layout of the root container

setPadding.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPadding padding}. Set the universal padding value. This single value is applied to all sides of the chart. Individual settings for each edge are also supported. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 24.

setPrimaryValuesColorPalette.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPrimaryValuesColorPalette primaryValuesColorPalette}. Set the color palette for axis 1 in dual charts. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is #8FBADD,#B8D4E9,#7AAED6,#A3C7E3,#3D88C4,#66A1D0,#297CBE,#5295CA,#005BA3,#146FB7,#005395,#0063B1.

parameters.sPrimaryValuesColorPalette: type: string[], description: New value for property primaryValuesColorPalette

setDrawingEffect.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect}. Set the drawing effect for the plot area. If this value is set to 'glossy', the plot area is glossy. If this value is set to 'normal', the plot area is matte. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is normal.

parameters.sDrawingEffect: type: sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_drawingEffect, description: New value for property drawingEffect

setFormatRules.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getFormatRules formatRules}. Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sFormatRules: type: object[], description: New value for property formatRules

destroyAnimation.!description: Destroys the animation in the aggregation {@link #getAnimation animation}.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_orientation (default: vertical)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: #748CB2,#9CC677,#EACF5E,#F9AD79,#D16A7C,#8873A2,#3A95B3,#B6D949,#FDD36C,#F47958,#A65084,#0063B1,#0DA841,#FCB71D,#F05620,#B22D6E,#3C368E,#8FB2CF,#95D4AB,#EAE98F,#F9BE92,#EC9A99,#BC98BD,#1EB7B2,#73C03C,#F48323,#EB271B,#D9B5CA,#AED1DA,#DFECB2,#FCDAB0,#F5BCB4)
    • {@link #getPrimaryValuesColorPalette primaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: #8FBADD,#B8D4E9,#7AAED6,#A3C7E3,#3D88C4,#66A1D0,#297CBE,#5295CA,#005BA3,#146FB7,#005395,#0063B1)
    • {@link #getSecondaryValuesColorPalette secondaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: #F6A09B,#F9C3C0,#F58E88,#F8B1AD,#F05B52,#F37D76,#EE4A40,#F16C64,#D92419,#ED382D,#C52117,#EB271B)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_tooltip
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_animation
    • {@link #getDataShape dataShape} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_dataShape
    • {@link #getBar bar} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_bar
    • {@link #getLine line} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_line
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnable enable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction_pan_orientation (default: both)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. attachShowTooltip.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} event of this sap.viz.ui5.Scatter. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.viz.ui5.Scatter itself. This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

sap.viz.ui5.Scatter.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Scatter Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Scatter
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getDataTransform dataTransform} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

If this value is set to 'glossy', the plot area is glossy. If this value is set to 'normal', the plot area is matte. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is normal.

parameters.sDrawingEffect: type: sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_drawingEffect, description: New value for property drawingEffect

getImageFill.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.12 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Gets current value of property {@link #getImageFill imageFill}. Set where the image fill is enabled. Default value is false.

setFormatRules.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getFormatRules formatRules}. Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sFormatRules: type: object[], description: New value for property formatRules

destroyAnimation.!description: Destroys the animation in the aggregation {@link #getAnimation animation}.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_orientation (default: vertical)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: #748CB2,#9CC677,#EACF5E,#F9AD79,#D16A7C,#8873A2,#3A95B3,#B6D949,#FDD36C,#F47958,#A65084,#0063B1,#0DA841,#FCB71D,#F05620,#B22D6E,#3C368E,#8FB2CF,#95D4AB,#EAE98F,#F9BE92,#EC9A99,#BC98BD,#1EB7B2,#73C03C,#F48323,#EB271B,#D9B5CA,#AED1DA,#DFECB2,#FCDAB0,#F5BCB4)
    • {@link #getPrimaryValuesColorPalette primaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: #8FBADD,#B8D4E9,#7AAED6,#A3C7E3,#3D88C4,#66A1D0,#297CBE,#5295CA,#005BA3,#146FB7,#005395,#0063B1)
    • {@link #getSecondaryValuesColorPalette secondaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: #F6A09B,#F9C3C0,#F58E88,#F8B1AD,#F05B52,#F37D76,#EE4A40,#F16C64,#D92419,#ED382D,#C52117,#EB271B)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getIsRoundCorner isRoundCorner} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getImageFill imageFill} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getImagePalette imagePalette} : string[] (default: http://www.sap.com/global/ui/images/global/sap-logo.png)
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_tooltip
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_animation
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

To use the event listener when creating charts, you must use an event that is passed by the events option. For more information on events options, see the usrOptions section of the createViz function in the API document.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

parameters.sName: type: string, description: New value for property name

getName.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getName name}.

Name of the dimension as displayed in the chart

getDataType.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDataType dataType}.

Data type of the dimension as displayed in the chart. Enumeration: string, number, date. Currently only in time series chart, it is required to set data type to 'date' if this column is going to be fed on 'timeAxis'.

getSorter.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSorter sorter}. Sorter Object of the dimension. There is a default comparator function, if no custom comparator is given. The function returns -1, 0 or 1, depending on the order of the two items and is suitable to be used as a comparator method for Array.sort. The object contains two entries:
  • bDescending:{boolean} (optional) define whether the sort order is descending. Default is false.
  • fnComparator:{function} (optional) a user defined comparator function, which have two input values to compare. The input value is an object, which contains value and displayValue (optional).

getAxis.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getAxis axis}.

Number of axis this dimension belongs to. Currently must be 1 or 2. Skip this property when use VizFrame.

setDisplayValue.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDisplayValue displayValue}. Display value for the dimension. Usually bound to some model field. It doesn't work with 'waterfallType' When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizSlider.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui5/controls/VizSider. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getVizType vizType} : string (default: column)
    • {@link #getUiConfig uiConfig} : object
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 800px)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 200px)
    • {@link #getValueAxisVisible valueAxisVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowPercentageLabel showPercentageLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowStartEndLabel showStartEndLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getRange range} : object
    • {@link #get_categoryRange _categoryRange} : object
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getDataset dataset} : sap.viz.ui5.data.Dataset
    • {@link #getFeeds feeds} : sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.feeds.FeedItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:rangeChanged rangeChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

Supported chart type: column, line, timeseries_column, timeseries_line When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is column.

setIsRoundCorner.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getIsRoundCorner isRoundCorner}. Set whether bars have rounded corners When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bIsRoundCorner: type: boolean, description: New value for property isRoundCorner

setPrimaryValuesColorPalette.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPrimaryValuesColorPalette primaryValuesColorPalette}. Set the color palette for axis 1 in dual charts. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is #8FBADD,#B8D4E9,#7AAED6,#A3C7E3,#3D88C4,#66A1D0,#297CBE,#5295CA,#005BA3,#146FB7,#005395,#0063B1.

parameters.sPrimaryValuesColorPalette: type: string[], description: New value for property primaryValuesColorPalette

setDrawingEffect.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect}. Set the drawing effect for the plot area. If this value is set to 'glossy', the plot area is glossy. If this value is set to 'normal', the plot area is matte. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is normal.

parameters.sDrawingEffect: type: sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_drawingEffect, description: New value for property drawingEffect

setFormatRules.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getFormatRules formatRules}. Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sFormatRules: type: object[], description: New value for property formatRules

sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_orientation (default: vertical)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: #748CB2,#9CC677,#EACF5E,#F9AD79,#D16A7C,#8873A2,#3A95B3,#B6D949,#FDD36C,#F47958,#A65084,#0063B1,#0DA841,#FCB71D,#F05620,#B22D6E,#3C368E,#8FB2CF,#95D4AB,#EAE98F,#F9BE92,#EC9A99,#BC98BD,#1EB7B2,#73C03C,#F48323,#EB271B,#D9B5CA,#AED1DA,#DFECB2,#FCDAB0,#F5BCB4)
    • {@link #getPrimaryValuesColorPalette primaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: #8FBADD,#B8D4E9,#7AAED6,#A3C7E3,#3D88C4,#66A1D0,#297CBE,#5295CA,#005BA3,#146FB7,#005395,#0063B1)
    • {@link #getSecondaryValuesColorPalette secondaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: #F6A09B,#F9C3C0,#F58E88,#F8B1AD,#F05B52,#F37D76,#EE4A40,#F16C64,#D92419,#ED382D,#C52117,#EB271B)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getIsRoundCorner isRoundCorner} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
    • {@link #getMode mode} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_mode (default: comparison)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_tooltip
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_animation
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

Deprecated! Since 1.12 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Gets current value of property {@link #getOrientation orientation}. Set the orientation of the plot area. Default value is vertical.

Settings for animations in the plot area

getSecondaryValuesColorPalette.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSecondaryValuesColorPalette secondaryValuesColorPalette}. Set the color palette for axis 2 in dual chart. Default value is #F6A09B,#F9C3C0,#F58E88,#F8B1AD,#F05B52,#F37D76,#EE4A40,#F16C64,#D92419,#ED382D,#C52117,#EB271B.

getColorPalette.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette}. Set the color palette for the chart. This is not supported for dual axis charts that have measureNamesDimension bound to the legend. Default value is #748CB2,#9CC677,#EACF5E,#F9AD79,#D16A7C,#8873A2,#3A95B3,#B6D949,#FDD36C,#F47958,#A65084,#0063B1,#0DA841,#FCB71D,#F05620,#B22D6E,#3C368E,#8FB2CF,#95D4AB,#EAE98F,#F9BE92,#EC9A99,#BC98BD,#1EB7B2,#73C03C,#F48323,#EB271B,#D9B5CA,#AED1DA,#DFECB2,#FCDAB0,#F5BCB4.

getFormatRules.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFormatRules formatRules}. Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

sap.viz.ui5.Area.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Area Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Area
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

attachHideTooltip.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} event of this sap.viz.ui5.Area. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.viz.ui5.Area itself. This event is deprecated, please use hideDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover out of the specific part of chart, no data is passed.
attachHideTooltip.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.viz.ui5.Area

Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Donut Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getDataTransform dataTransform} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDataLoading dataLoading} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDataUpdating dataUpdating} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getResizing resizing} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

setDataLoading.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDataLoading dataLoading}. Set whether the data loading animation is enabled When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bDataLoading: type: boolean, description: New value for property dataLoading

getResizing.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getResizing resizing}. Set whether the resizing animation is enabled Default value is true.

sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_ani.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Settings for animations in the plot area

setResizing.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getResizing resizing}. Set whether the resizing animation is enabled When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bResizing: type: boolean, description: New value for property resizing

setDataUpdating.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDataUpdating dataUpdating}. Set whether the data updating animation is enabled When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bDataUpdating: type: boolean, description: New value for property dataUpdating

Deprecated! Since 1.20 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Gets current value of property {@link #getTimeBased timeBased}. Set whether it is time based scatter/bubble Default value is false.

setFormatRules.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getFormatRules formatRules}. Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sFormatRules: type: object[], description: New value for property formatRules

sap.viz.ui5.types.Bubble.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Bubble Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: #748CB2,#9CC677,#EACF5E,#F9AD79,#D16A7C,#8873A2,#3A95B3,#B6D949,#FDD36C,#F47958,#A65084,#0063B1,#0DA841,#FCB71D,#F05620,#B22D6E,#3C368E,#8FB2CF,#95D4AB,#EAE98F,#F9BE92,#EC9A99,#BC98BD,#1EB7B2,#73C03C,#F48323,#EB271B,#D9B5CA,#AED1DA,#DFECB2,#FCDAB0,#F5BCB4)
    • {@link #getShapePalette shapePalette} : string[] (default: circle,square,diamond,triangleUp,triangleDown,triangleLeft,triangleRight,cross,intersection)
    • {@link #getMinMarkerSize minMarkerSize} : int
    • {@link #getMaxPriValue maxPriValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMinPriValue minPriValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMaxSecValue maxSecValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMinSecValue minSecValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMaxBubbleWidth maxBubbleWidth} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMinBubbleWidth minBubbleWidth} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMaxBubbleHeight maxBubbleHeight} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMinBubbleHeight minBubbleHeight} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getTimeBased timeBased} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bubble_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
    • {@link #getShowNegativeValues showNegativeValues} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bubble_animation
    • {@link #getAxisTooltip axisTooltip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bubble_axisTooltip
    • {@link #getHoverline hoverline} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bubble_hoverline
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

sap.viz.ui5.Heatmap.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Heatmap Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Heatmap
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

sap.viz.ui5.DualCombination.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.DualCombination Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination
    • {@link #getYAxis2 yAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

attachHideTooltip.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} event of this sap.viz.ui5.DualCombination. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.viz.ui5.DualCombination itself. This event is deprecated, please use hideDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover out of the specific part of chart, no data is passed.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_gridline.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_gridline Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)

    • {@link #getShowLastLine showLastLine} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_gridline_type (default: line)
    • {@link #getColor color} : string (default: #d8d8d8)
    • {@link #getSize size} : int (default: 1)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui5/controls/VizFrame. For more information on the available info chart types, see the following documentation. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getVizType vizType} : string (default: column)
    • {@link #getVizProperties vizProperties} : object
    • {@link #getVizScales vizScales} : object
    • {@link #getVizCustomizations vizCustomizations} : object
    • {@link #getLegendVisible legendVisible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getDataset dataset} : sap.viz.ui5.data.Dataset
    • {@link #getFeeds feeds} : sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.feeds.FeedItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:renderComplete renderComplete} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.BaseControl#constructor sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.BaseControl} can be used as well.

parameters.oOptions: type: object, description: a JSON object contains combination of properties, feeds and data model.

fireSelectData.!description: Fires event {@link #event:selectData selectData} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

attachRenderComplete.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:renderComplete renderComplete} event of this sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame itself. Event fires when the rendering ends.

    • {@link #event:dataRefresh dataRefresh} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataError dataError} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

setContext.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getContext context}. Additional data which works with data context in this dataset. The input could be an array. Each item represents a dimension that is added as the additional information based on data context. The input could be a string of dimension id, or object like this {id: "name", showInTooltip: true}. If showInTooltip is false, the dimensions set in this API will not show in popover or tooltip. However other dimensions in data context will show. In selection event, all dimension information (including the dimension set in this API) will be included. Context will be shown by default in tooltip if only set context with string or string of array. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.oContext: type: any, description: New value for property context

They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip_background.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip_background Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getColor color} : string (default: #ffffff)
    • {@link #getBorderColor borderColor} : string (default: #cccccc)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

setColor.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getColor color}. Define the background color of the tooltip. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is #ffffff.

parameters.sColor: type: string, description: New value for property color

setBorderColor.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBorderColor borderColor}. Define the background border color of the tooltip. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is #cccccc.

parameters.sBorderColor: type: string, description: New value for property borderColor

sap.viz.ui5.Column.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Column Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.VerticalBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} event of this sap.viz.ui5.Column. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.viz.ui5.Column itself. This event is deprecated, please use hideDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover out of the specific part of chart, no data is passed.

Gets current value of property {@link #getTimeBased timeBased}. Set whether it is time based scatter/bubble Default value is false.

setFormatRules.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getFormatRules formatRules}. Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sFormatRules: type: object[], description: New value for property formatRules

sap.viz.ui5.controls.Popover.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui5/controls/Popover. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCustomDataControl customDataControl} : any
    • {@link #getActionItems actionItems} : object[]
    • {@link #getFormatString formatString} : any
    • {@link #getShowLine showLine} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.BaseControl#constructor sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.BaseControl} can be used as well.

Dispatches "feedsChanged" event when the feeding changes due to add/remove/change feeding items on feeding panel, drag and drop object onto VizFrame, or switch chart type by UI operation. sap.viz.ui5.VizContainer.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui5/VizContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getVizType vizType} : string
    • {@link #getVizCss vizCss} : string
    • {@link #getVizProperties vizProperties} : object
    • {@link #getEnableMorphing enableMorphing} : boolean
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getVizData vizData} : sap.viz.ui5.data.Dataset
    • {@link #getAnalysisObjectsForPicker analysisObjectsForPicker} : sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.feeds.AnalysisObject[]
    • {@link #getFeeds feeds} : sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.feeds.FeedItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:feedsChanged feedsChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:vizTypeChanged vizTypeChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:vizDefinitionChanged vizDefinitionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.BaseControl#constructor sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.BaseControl} can be used as well.

removeAllAnalysisObjectsForPicker.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getAnalysisObjectsForPicker analysisObjectsForPicker}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

parameters.oOptions: type: object, description: a JSON object contains combination of css, properties, feeds and data model.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.viz.ui5.VizContainer itself. Event fires when the mouse hover out of the specific part of chart, no data is passed.

Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
List (Enum) type sap.viz.ui5.types.Title_alignment

setIsGeoPie.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.12 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getIsGeoPie isGeoPie}. Set whether the chart displays as a geo pie chart. If this value is set to 'true', the chart displays as a geo pie chart. If this value is set to 'false', the chart does not display as a geo pie chart. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bIsGeoPie: type: boolean, description: New value for property isGeoPie

setDrawingEffect.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect}. Set the drawing effect of the pie When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is normal.

parameters.sDrawingEffect: type: sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie_drawingEffect, description: New value for property drawingEffect

getIsDonut.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIsDonut isDonut}. Set the chart to display as a donut or a pie. If this value is set to 'true', the chart displays as a donut. If this value is set to 'false', the chart displays as a pie. Default value is false.

setIsDonut.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIsDonut isDonut}. Set the chart to display as a donut or a pie. If this value is set to 'true', the chart displays as a donut. If this value is set to 'false', the chart displays as a pie. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bIsDonut: type: boolean, description: New value for property isDonut

setFormatRules.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFormatRules formatRules}. Rules to format data points, sample: [{condition: [{Key1:"Value1", Key2:"Value2"}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:"Value3"}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: "condition" and "color". The relation among the condition object in "condition" array is "OR", which means the data point that met any condition in the array will apply the "color". If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, the last rule would take effect. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sFormatRules: type: object[], description: New value for property formatRules

sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: #748CB2,#9CC677,#EACF5E,#F9AD79,#D16A7C,#8873A2,#3A95B3,#B6D949,#FDD36C,#F47958,#A65084,#0063B1,#0DA841,#FCB71D,#F05620,#B22D6E,#3C368E,#8FB2CF,#95D4AB,#EAE98F,#F9BE92,#EC9A99,#BC98BD,#1EB7B2,#73C03C,#F48323,#EB271B,#D9B5CA,#AED1DA,#DFECB2,#FCDAB0,#F5BCB4)
    • {@link #getIsDonut isDonut} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsGeoPie isGeoPie} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getValign valign} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie_valign (default: top)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
    • {@link #getPlotScale plotScale} : float (default: 1)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie_animation
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie_tooltip
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

getAnimation.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getAnimation animation}.

Settings for animations in the plot area

getColorPalette.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette}. Set the color palette for the sectors of the pie chart Default value is #748CB2,#9CC677,#EACF5E,#F9AD79,#D16A7C,#8873A2,#3A95B3,#B6D949,#FDD36C,#F47958,#A65084,#0063B1,#0DA841,#FCB71D,#F05620,#B22D6E,#3C368E,#8FB2CF,#95D4AB,#EAE98F,#F9BE92,#EC9A99,#BC98BD,#1EB7B2,#73C03C,#F48323,#EB271B,#D9B5CA,#AED1DA,#DFECB2,#FCDAB0,#F5BCB4.

getFormatRules.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFormatRules formatRules}.

Rules to format data points, sample: [{condition: [{Key1:"Value1", Key2:"Value2"}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:"Value3"}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: "condition" and "color". The relation among the condition object in "condition" array is "OR", which means the data point that met any condition in the array will apply the "color". If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, the last rule would take effect.

They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame}(new sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame({'vizType': 'dual_bar'})) control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

sap.viz.ui5.DualBar.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.DualBar Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar
    • {@link #getXAxis2 xAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

attachHideTooltip.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} event of this sap.viz.ui5.DualBar. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.viz.ui5.DualBar itself. This event is deprecated, please use hideDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover out of the specific part of chart, no data is passed.

sap.viz.ui5.DualLine.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.DualLine Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Line
    • {@link #getYAxis2 yAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

getBorder.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getBorder border}.

Settings for the border

setFormatRules.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getFormatRules formatRules}. Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sFormatRules: type: object[], description: New value for property formatRules

The supported settings are:

The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

getLegendValues.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getLegendValues legendValues}.

Set the MBC legend values. For example, [10,11,12,13,14,15]. The values in the array should be in ascending order. If the number of values in the array is smaller than the MBC legend segment number, the MBC legend automatically calculates the values according to the data. If the number of values in the legendValues array is larger than MBC legend segment number, then only the first "segment number + 1" values are used.

decorations.!description:
Set decorations relating to interaction. Each item that is an object of {name: 'decoration name', fn: 'decoration callback function'} is a decoration. Currently two decorations are supported: showDetail and hideDetail. These two decorations can be used to create a user-defined tooltip.

If these 2 decorations are used, the default tooltip is not used, and the user should implement a custom tooltip. The showDetail decoration is called when the tooltip is shown, and the hideDetail decoration is called when the tooltip is hidden.

The arguments of showDetail are one object of {mode: 'tooltip mode', data: 'data of hovering selected data point', position: 'mouse position', container: 'chart container dom element', selectedNumber: 'number of selected data points'}. 'tooltip mode' is either 'infoMode' or 'actionMode'. Hovering over an unselected data point displays the infoMode tooltip, while hovering over a selected data point displays the actionMode tooltip. 'data' is an array of dimensions and measures, where each item is an object of {name: 'dimension name or measure name', value: 'dimension member or measure value', type: 'literal string of dimension or measure'}. For instance, {name: 'Country', value: 'China', type: 'dimension'}, or {name: 'Profit', value: 159, type: 'measure'}.

The arguments of hideDetail are a string representing tooltip mode, i.e. what kind of tooltip should be hidden.

supportedEventNames.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.12 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
Set supported event names

mode.!description: Set the selection mode. If this value is set to 'exclusive' or 'single', only one set of data points can be selected at once. If this value is set to 'inclusive' or 'multiple', multiple sets of data points can be selected at once. If this value is set to 'none', no sets of data points can be selected. The values 'single' and 'multiple' are deprecated; please remove them from your chart.

Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Bullet Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bullet
    • {@link #getXAxis2 xAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getYAxis2 yAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.
